title: Commonwealth: Leadership row ahead of leaders' summit
description: In an exclusive interview, Jamaica's foreign minister Kamina Johnson Smith denies being a proxy candidate for the UK government.

title: Watergate: Why the scandal still resonates 50 years later
description: A Watergate prosecutor on the similarities she sees between that scandal and last year's US Capitol riot.

title: Week in pictures: 11-17 June 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Canadian Grand Prix: Charles Leclerc hit with grid penalty after engine component change
description: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc suffers the latest of a series of blows to his title hopes with a grid penalty for excessive engine usage.

title: Yellowstone: Historic floods could reach eastern Montana
description: The national park, celebrating its 150th anniversary, has been closed during its tourist season.

title: Russia's Putin condemns 'mad and thoughtless' Western sanctions
description: The Russian president says the economic restrictions are "more harmful" to those who imposed them.

title: Sign language 999 BSL service launched for deaf people
description: Deaf people can make 999 calls via a service connecting them to a British Sign Language interpreter.

title: Billie Jean King: ‘I want everyone to play’
description: At nearly 80, the former world number one is still campaigning for tennis to be more inclusive.

title: Heathrow Terminal 2 baggage piles up after malfunction
description: Passengers post pictures on social media as piles of luggage fill the airport's Terminal 2.

title: Putin criticises sanctions and Eurovision row - round-up
description: Russia's leader says sanctions are "mad and thoughtless", as the war stops Ukraine from hosting Eurovision.

title: Queen's: Filip Krajinovic beats Ryan Peniston to reach semi-finals
description: Watch the best shots of Filip Krajinovic's quarter-final victory over British wildcard entry Ryan Peniston 4-6 6-3 6-3 at Queen's.

title: Eurovision Song Contest: Which UK cities could host 2023 show?
description: Glasgow, Manchester, Leeds and Liverpool all express an interest if the UK ends up staging the show.

title: Coeliac patient died days after being fed Weetabix, inquest hears
description: An 80-year-old coeliac patient was given the cereal in hospital and died four days later.

title: Gatwick: Passenger with restricted mobility dies after leaving flight
description: The man, a restricted mobility passenger, left an EasyJet plane and later fell on an escalator.

title: Three things we're cutting back on as prices rise
description: People in Birmingham and Kent tell the BBC how they are cutting back to cope with the cost of living crisis.

title: Gatwick cuts summer flights after staff shortages
description: The airport says it will lead to a more reliable service, after a wave of cancellations and delays.

title: Julian Assange can be extradited, says UK home secretary
description: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange’s extradition to the US is approved by UK Home Secretary Priti Patel.

title: Premiership final: Leicester Tigers v Saracens - Richard Wigglesworth starts against old club
description: Veteran Leicester Tigers scrum-half Richard Wigglesworth comes in to start Saturday's Premiership final against Saracens.

title: Eurovision: UK could host 2023 event, organisers say
description: Officials are in talks with BBC after concluding contest cannot be held in winning country Ukraine.

title: Covid infections up after Platinum Jubilee celebrations
description: The latest UK figures cover the long weekend of partying and suggest one in 45 has Covid.

title: Julian Assange: What is extradition and how does it work?
description: The UK Home Secretary has approved Julian Assange's extradition to the US. How does the process work?

title: ‘Children are being abused’ – gymnasts on damning report
description: A "damning" report detailing mistreatment of gymnasts in Britain shows that "child abuse" of athletes was taking place, says a former gymnast.

title: Pensions: Millions receive wrong amount 'for decades'
description: The errors, mostly worth a few pence a week, are thought to have been discovered in the 1990s.

title: NBA Finals: Stephen Curry's highlights as Warriors win title
description: Watch Stephen Curry's highlights as he leads the Golden State Warriors to the NBA title with a 34-point MVP performance in their 103-90 win over the Boston Celtics to clinch the series 4-2.

title: Mental health placements: 'No-one could visit me, no-one could bring me clean clothes'
description: Why are hundreds of mental health patients still being sent far away from home for treatment?

title: SPFL fixtures 2022-23: Champions Celtic start against Aberdeen, Rangers visit Livingston
description: Celtic will start their Scottish Premiership title defence at home to Aberdeen on Sunday, 31 July, while Livingston v Rangers launches the season the previous day at midday.

title: People cut back on food, fuel and clothes as prices rise, BBC survey suggests
description: More than eight in 10 people say they are worried about the cost-of-living, a BBC survey suggests.

title: Tribeca Film Festival 2022: Sheep farmer film wins best short documentary award
description: The short film features sheep farmer Wilf Davies who never leaves his home in the Teifi Valley.

title: Republican Senate gun negotiator walks out of talks
description: "We're about run out of our rope here," a frustrated Senator John Cornyn said as he left Washington.

title: The papers: Warnings of 'pain ahead' with inflation to hit 11%
description: The front pages focus on a forecast of sharp price rises as the cost of living crisis continues.

title: Arthur Hughes: First disabled Richard III is 'big gesture' from RSC
description: Arthur Hughes is the first disabled actor to play Richard III - who had a curved spine - at the RSC.

title: Fuel prices: Could I save money driving an electric car?
description: As petrol and diesel prices continue to increase, interest in electric vehicles is rising

title: Football shirts: 'People put such value on these bits of polyester'
description: Football shirt-collecting is booming. Why do some people seem to love the tops as much as the game?

title: Lavrov: Russia is not squeaky clean and not ashamed
description: Russia's foreign minister tells the BBC that the West is pressing UN officials to amplify fake news.

title: Nepal to move Everest base camp from melting glacier
description: Nepal is preparing to move its Everest base camp as the glacier it stands on becomes less stable.
